problem: How many ordered pairs, $(x, y)$, of positive integers satisfy the equation $xy = 144$?
solution: Since $xy = 144$, $x$ can be any positive divisor of 144.  Since $y = \dfrac{144}{x}$, there is exactly one positive integer $y$ for each positive integer $x$.  We can count the ordered pairs by counting the values of $x$, which are the divisors of 144: $$ 144 = 2^4 \cdot 3^2 \qquad \Rightarrow \qquad t(144) = (4 + 1)(2 + 1) = \boxed{15}. $$
